trans-unit.source: Provides all the context information required by the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to parse an XML fragment.

Initializes a new instance of the `XmlParserContext` class with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref>, `xml:lang`, and `xml:space` values.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> to use to atomize strings.
If this is `null`, the name table used to construct the nsMgr is used instead.
For more information about atomized strings, see <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref> to use for looking up namespace information, or `null`.
The `xml:lang` scope.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> value indicating the `xml:space` scope.
nt is not the same `XmlNameTable` used to construct nsMgr.

Initializes a new instance of the `XmlParserContext` class with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref>, `xml:lang`, `xml:space`, and encoding.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> to use to atomize strings.
If this is `null`, the name table used to construct the nsMgr is used instead.
For more information on atomized strings, see <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref> to use for looking up namespace information, or `null`.
The `xml:lang` scope.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> value indicating the `xml:space` scope.
An <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref> object indicating the encoding setting.
nt is not the same `XmlNameTable` used to construct nsMgr.

Initializes a new instance of the `XmlParserContext` class with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref>, base URI, `xml:lang`, `xml:space`, and document type values.
This constructor supplies all `DocumentType` information required by <xref:System.Xml.XmlValidatingReader>.
If this `XmlParserContext` is passed to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlTextReader>, all DTD information is ignored.
If you pass a DTD as the `internalSubset`, the DTD is used for entity resolution, not for document validation.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> to use to atomize strings.
If this is `null`, the name table used to construct the nsMgr is used instead.
For more information about atomized strings, see <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref> to use for looking up namespace information, or `null`.
The name of the document type declaration.
The public identifier.
The system identifier.
The internal DTD subset.
The DTD subset is used for entity resolution, not for document validation.
The base URI for the XML fragment (the location from which the fragment was loaded).
The `xml:lang` scope.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> value indicating the `xml:space` scope.
nt is not the same `XmlNameTable` used to construct nsMgr.

Initializes a new instance of the `XmlParserContext` class with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref>, base URI, `xml:lang`, `xml:space`, encoding, and document type values.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> to use to atomize strings.
If this is `null`, the name table used to construct the nsMgr is used instead.
For more information about atomized strings, see <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref> to use for looking up namespace information, or `null`.
The name of the document type declaration.
The public identifier.
The system identifier.
The internal DTD subset.
The DTD is used for entity resolution, not for document validation.
The base URI for the XML fragment (the location from which the fragment was loaded).
The `xml:lang` scope.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> value indicating the `xml:space` scope.
An <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref> object indicating the encoding setting.
nt is not the same `XmlNameTable` used to construct nsMgr.
Gets or sets the base URI.
A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various W3C standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore may contain nodes that come from different places.
`BaseURI` shows where these nodes originated.
The base URI to use to resolve the DTD file.
Gets or sets the name of the document type declaration.

This property, along with <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.PublicId%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.SystemId%2A>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.InternalSubset%2A>, provides all the document type declaration information.
It is used to find and load the necessary DTD information so that you get all the default attributes and entities defined in the DTD.
The name of the document type declaration.
Gets or sets the encoding type.
An <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref> object indicating the encoding type.
Gets or sets the internal DTD subset.

This property, along with <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.DocTypeName%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.PublicId%2A>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.SystemId%2A>, provides all the document type declaration information.
It is used to find and load the necessary DTD information so that you get all the default attributes and entities defined in the DTD.
The DTD is used for entity resolution, not for document validation.
The internal DTD subset.
For example, this property returns everything between the square brackets .
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref>.
The `NamespaceManager` defines the current namespace scope and provides methods for looking up namespace information.
The `XmlNamespaceManager`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> used to atomize strings.
For more information on atomized strings, see <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref>.
The `XmlNameTable`.
Gets or sets the public identifier.

This property, along with <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.DocTypeName%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.SystemId%2A>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.InternalSubset%2A>, provides all the document type declaration information.
It is used to find and load the required DTD information so that you get all the default attributes and entities defined in the DTD.
The public identifier.
Gets or sets the system identifier.

This property, along with <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.DocTypeName%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.PublicId%2A>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.InternalSubset%2A>, provides all the document type declaration information.
It is used to find and load the necessary DTD information so that you get all the default attributes and entities defined in the DTD.
The system identifier.
Gets or sets the current `xml:lang` scope.
For details on valid `xml:lang` values, refer to section 2.12 of the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 recommendation.
The current `xml:lang` scope.
If there is no `xml:lang` in scope, `String.Empty` is returned.
Gets or sets the current `xml:space` scope.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> value indicating the `xml:space` scope.
